It would be a bad day in magic if they ever printed bears for ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) and ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol). posts.post_content:
Wound up with about 4 of these in my draft deck at the launch party. I left them out, but I should have played some of them, because I was short on 2-drops, and my goblin grenade sat uselessly in my hand most of the time. Even this guy has his role.  
  
I do think [Goblin Shortcutter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Shortcutter) would be a good core set replacement, but then red would need another plain vanilla creature somewhere, and let's face it, they're always bad. At least [Bonebreaker Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonebreaker Giant) is an improvement on M11's [Berserkers of Blood Ridge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Berserkers of Blood Ridge).
posts.html:
Wound up with about 4 of these in my draft deck at the launch party. I left them out, but I should have played some of them, because I was short on 2-drops, and my goblin grenade sat uselessly in my hand most of the time. Even this guy has his role.

I do think Goblin Shortcutter would be a good core set replacement, but then red would need another plain vanilla creature somewhere, and let's face it, they're always bad. At least Bonebreaker Giant is an improvement on M11's Berserkers of Blood Ridge.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (7/16/2011 5:18:47 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Interestingly, no one here's complaining about the Flavour Text and the Art, which hasn't changed since Portals 2k.  
  
But you know? I don't think that's a bad thing. The art's fine, and it's not similar to the older style of art.   
  
Also, the Piker isn't too bad in a draft. I've always noticed that the people who win games either had a perfect draft deck (like 4x [Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak), or 2x [Krenko, Mob Boss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krenko, Mob Boss) + 4x [Krenko's Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krenko's Command)) or a ton of creatures, and cards like this and [Zombie Goliath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombie Goliath) just add a little bit of an edge to your deck.   
  
obviously, don't play this over something like [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt).
posts.html:
Interestingly, no one here's complaining about the Flavour Text and the Art, which hasn't changed since Portals 2k.

But you know? I don't think that's a bad thing. The art's fine, and it's not similar to the older style of art.

Also, the Piker isn't too bad in a draft. I've always noticed that the people who win games either had a perfect draft deck (like 4x Mana Leak, or 2x Krenko, Mob Boss + 4x Krenko's Command) or a ton of creatures, and cards like this and Zombie Goliath just add a little bit of an edge to your deck.

obviously, don't play this over something like Lightning Bolt.

Posted By: SquirePath (1/1/2012 2:48:08 PM)

posts.post_content:
I think it's okay to give new players cards like this, because they need to figure out which end of the thing is sharp first. If you throw at them a bunch of powerful cards w/ a ton of texts, they're gonna get confused really quick. Let them start out with simple things, and then let them explore what they decide to be 'good' or 'bad', and eventually they'll become more experienced players. After all, letting them fail is letting them learn.  
Furthermore, in a game of a new player against a new player, what's wrong with a Goblin Piker vs. a Runeclaw Bear?
posts.html:
I think it's okay to give new players cards like this, because they need to figure out which end of the thing is sharp first. If you throw at them a bunch of powerful cards w/ a ton of texts, they're gonna get confused really quick.
